verses.text: Yet now hear, O Jacob my servant; And Israel, whom I have chosen:
Thus saith the \sc Lord\sc* that made thee, And formed thee from the womb, \add which\add* will help thee; Fear not, O Jacob, my servant; And \add thou\add*, Jeshurun, whom I have chosen.
For I will pour water upon \add him that is\add* thirsty, And floods upon the dry \add ground:\add* I will pour my spirit upon thy seed, And my blessing upon thine offspring:
And they shall spring up \add as\add* among the grass, As willows by the water courses.

One shall say, I \add am\add* the \sc Lordâ€™s\sc*; And another shall call \add himself\add* by the name of Jacob; And another shall subscribe \add with\add* his hand unto the \sc Lord\sc*, And surname \add himself\add* by the name of Israel.
Thus saith the \sc Lord\sc* the King of Israel, And his redeemer the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts; I \add am\add* the first, and I \add am\add* the last; And besides me \add there is\add* no God.
And who, as I, shall call, And shall declare it, and set it in order for me, Since I appointed the ancient people? And the \add things\add* that are coming, and shall come, let them shew unto them.

Fear ye not, neither be afraid: Have not I told thee from that time, And have declared \add it?\add* ye \add are\add* even my witnesses. Is there a God besides me? Yea, \add there is\add* no God; I know not \add any\add*.

They that make a graven image \add are\add* all of them vanity; And their delectable \add things\add* shall not profit; And they \add are\add* their own witnesses; They see not, nor know; that they may be ashamed.
Who hath formed a god, or molten a graven image \add That\add* is profitable for nothing?

Behold, all his fellows shall be ashamed: And the workmen, they \add are\add* of men: Let them all be gathered together, let them stand \add up;\add* \add Yet\add* they shall fear, \add and\add* they shall be ashamed together.

The smith \add with\add* the tongs both worketh in the coals, And fashioneth it with hammers, And worketh it with the strength of his arms: Yea, he is hungry, and his strength faileth: He drinketh no water, and is faint.

The carpenter stretcheth out \add his\add* rule; he marketh it out with a line; He fitteth it with planes, and he marketh it out with the compass, And maketh it after the figure of a man, according to the beauty of a man; That it may remain \add in\add* the house.
\add He\add* heweth him down cedars, and taketh the cypress and the oak, Which he strengtheneth for himself among the trees of the forest: He planteth an ash, and the rain doth nourish \add it\add*.

Then shall it be for a man to burn: For he will take thereof, and warm himself; Yea, he kindleth \add it\add*, and baketh bread; Yea, he maketh a god, and worshippeth \add it;\add* He maketh it a graven image, and falleth down thereto.
He burneth part thereof in the fire; With part thereof he eateth flesh; He roasteth roast, and is satisfied: Yea, he warmeth himself, and saith, Aha, I am warm, I have seen the fire:

And the residue thereof he maketh a god, \add even\add* his graven image: He falleth down unto it, and worshippeth \add it\add*, and prayeth unto it, And saith, Deliver me; for thou \add art\add* my god.
They have not known nor understood: For he hath shut their eyes, that \add they\add* cannot see; \add And\add* their hearts, that \add they\add* cannot understand.

And none considereth in his heart, Neither \add is there\add* knowledge nor understanding to say, I have burnt part of it in the fire; Yea, also I have baked bread upon the coals thereof; I have roasted flesh, and eaten \add it:\add* And shall I make the residue thereof an abomination? Shall I fall down to the stock of a tree?
He feedeth on ashes: A deceived heart hath turned him aside, That he cannot deliver his soul, nor say, \add Is there\add* not a lie in my right hand?
Remember these, O Jacob And Israel; for thou \add art\add* my servant: I have formed thee; thou \add art\add* my servant: O Israel, thou shalt not be forgotten of me.
I have blotted out, as a thick cloud, thy transgressions, And, as a cloud, thy sins: Return unto me; for I have redeemed thee.

Sing, O ye heavens; for the \sc Lord\sc* hath done \add it:\add* Shout, ye lower parts of the earth: Break forth \add into\add* singing, ye mountains, O forest, and every tree therein: For the \sc Lord\sc* hath redeemed Jacob, And glorified himself in Israel.

Thus saith the \sc Lord\sc*, thy redeemer, And he that formed thee from the womb, I \add am\add* the \sc Lord\sc* that maketh all \add things;\add* That stretcheth forth the heavens alone; That spreadeth abroad the earth by myself;
That frustrateth the tokens of the liars, And maketh diviners mad; That turneth wise \add men\add* backward, And maketh their knowledge foolish;

That confirmeth the word of his servant, And performeth the counsel of his messengers; That saith to Jerusalem, Thou shalt be inhabited; And to the cities of Judah, Ye shall be built, And I will raise up the decayed places thereof:
That saith to the deep, Be dry, And I will dry up thy rivers:
That saith of Cyrus, \add He is\add* my shepherd, And shall perform all my pleasure: Even saying to Jerusalem, Thou shalt be built; And \add to\add* the temple, Thy foundation shall be laid.
